habitat_description:
The range of the spotted chorus frog includes central Kansas to south Texas into extreme northeast Tamaulipas (Conant and Collins 1998). In Oklahoma, they are found near the Cimarron River in Tucker (Lannoo 2005). Introduced in Montana (Behler and King 1979).

Habitats include grass prairies. Found away from water exclusively at night or early evening. Inactive during dry weather (Conant and Collins 1998). This species is known to avoid deep water pools, muddier less protected livestock ponds where spadefoot and true toads breed, also known and to never breed in permanent bodies of water. Breeding occurs in temporary and shallow ponds, marshes, water-lily ponds, grassy ponds, buffalo wallows, flooded fields, mesquite ponds, and other ephemeral ponds. When not breeding and away from streams, adults are often found in prairies and prairie islands in savannas, pastures and fields (Lannoo 2005). Inactive under dry conditions (Behler and King 1979).
